parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description:
Project endpoint. In the form "https://your-ai-services-account-name.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/_project"
if your Foundry Hub has only one Project, or to use the default Project in your Hub. Or in the form 
"https://your-ai-services-account-name.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/your-project-name" if you want to explicitly
specify the Foundry Project name.

AgentEvaluation.description: Evaluation response for agent evaluation run.

id.description: Identifier of the agent evaluation run.

status.description: Status of the agent evaluation. Options: Running, Completed, Failed.

error.description: The reason of the request failure for the long running process, if applicable.

AgentEvaluationRedactionConfiguration.description: The redaction configuration will allow the user to control what is redacted.

redactScoreProperties.description: Redact score properties. If not specified, the default is to redact in production.

threadId.description: Identifier of the agent thread. This field is mandatory currently, but it will be optional in the future.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

appInsightsConnectionString.description: Pass the AppInsights connection string to the agent evaluation for the evaluation results and the errors logs.

AgentEvaluationResult.description: Result for the agent evaluation evaluator run.

evaluator.description: Evaluator's name. This is the name of the evaluator that was used to evaluate the agent's completion.

score.description: Score of the given evaluator. No restriction on range.

status.description: Status of the evaluator result. Options: Running, Completed, Failed, NotApplicable.

version.description: Version of the evaluator that was used to evaluate the agent's completion.

threadId.description: The unique identifier of the thread.

runId.description: The unique identifier of the run.

error.description: A string explaining why there was an error, if applicable.

additionalDetails.description: Additional properties relevant to the evaluator. These will differ between evaluators.

maxRequestRate.description: Maximum request rate per hour (0 to 1000).

AssetCredentialResponse.description: Represents a reference to a blob for consumption

blobReference.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

AssistantMessage.description: A message generated by the assistant in response to previous messages.

content.description: Response content generated by the assistant.

values.name: Easy
values.description: Represents a default set of easy complexity attacks. Easy complexity attacks require less effort, such as translation of a prompt into some encoding, and does not require any Large Language Model to convert or orchestrate.

values.name: Moderate
values.description: Represents a default set of moderate complexity attacks. Moderate complexity attacks require having access to resources such as another generative AI model.

values.name: Difficult
values.description: Represents a default set of difficult complexity attacks. Difficult complexity attacks include attacks that require access to significant resources and effort to execute an attack such as knowledge of search-based algorithms in addition to a generative AI model.

values.name: AsciiArt
values.description: Generates visual art using ASCII characters, often used for creative or obfuscation purposes.

values.name: AsciiSmuggler
values.description: Conceals data within ASCII characters, making it harder to detect.

values.name: Atbash
values.description: Implements the Atbash cipher, a simple substitution cipher where each letter is mapped to its reverse.

values.name: Base64
values.description: Encodes binary data into a text format using Base64, commonly used for data transmission.

values.name: Binary
values.description: Converts text into binary code, representing data in a series of 0s and 1s.

values.name: Caesar
values.description: Applies the Caesar cipher, a substitution cipher that shifts characters by a fixed number of positions.

values.name: CharacterSpace
values.description: Alters text by adding spaces between characters, often used for obfuscation.

values.name: Jailbreak
values.description: Injects specially crafted prompts to bypass AI safeguards, known as User Injected Prompt Attacks (UPIA).

values.name: AnsiiAttack
values.description: Utilizes ANSI escape sequences to manipulate text appearance and behavior.

values.name: CharacterSwap
values.description: Swaps characters within text to create variations or obfuscate the original content.

values.name: SuffixAppend
values.description: Appends an adversarial suffix to the prompt.

values.name: StringJoin
values.description: Joins multiple strings together, often used for concatenation or obfuscation.

values.name: UnicodeConfusable
values.description: Uses Unicode characters that look similar to standard characters, creating visual confusion.

values.name: UnicodeSubstitution
values.description: Substitutes standard characters with Unicode equivalents, often for obfuscation.

values.name: Diacritic
values.description: Adds diacritical marks to characters, changing their appearance and sometimes their meaning.

values.name: Flip
values.description: Flips characters from front to back, creating a mirrored effect.

values.name: Leetspeak
values.description: Transforms text into Leetspeak, a form of encoding that replaces letters with similar-looking numbers or symbols.

values.name: ROT13
values.description: Applies the ROT13 cipher, a simple substitution cipher that shifts characters by 13 positions.

values.name: Morse
values.description: Encodes text into Morse code, using dots and dashes to represent characters.

values.name: Url
values.description: Encodes text into URL format.

values.name: Baseline
values.description: Represents the baseline direct adversarial probing, which is used by attack strategies as the attack objective.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

connectionName.description: Name of connection to Azure AI Search

indexName.description: Name of index in Azure AI Search resource to attach

AzureOpenAIModelConfiguration.description: Azure OpenAI model configuration. The API version would be selected by the service for querying the model.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name for AOAI model. Example: gpt-4o if in AIServices or connection based `connection_name/deployment_name` (e.g. `my-aoai-connection/gpt-4o`).

BaseCredentials.description: A base class for connection credentials

type.description: The type of credential used by the connection

blobUri.description: Blob URI path for client to upload data. Example: https://blob.windows.core.net/Container/Path

storageAccountArmId.description: ARM ID of the storage account to use.

credential.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

Connection.description: Response from the list and get connections operations

name.description: The friendly name of the connection, provided by the user.

id.description: A unique identifier for the connection, generated by the service

target.description: The connection URL to be used for this service

isDefault.description: Whether the connection is tagged as the default connection of its type

credentials.description: The credentials used by the connection

ConnectionType.description: The Type (or category) of the connection

DatasetType.description: Enum to determine the type of data.

values.name: uri_file
values.description: URI file.

values.name: uri_folder
values.description: URI folder.

isReference.description: Indicates if the dataset holds a reference to the storage, or the dataset manages storage itself. If true, the underlying data will not be deleted when the dataset version is deleted

connectionName.description: The Azure Storage Account connection name. Required if startPendingUploadVersion was not called before creating the Dataset

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

values.name: ModelDeployment
values.description: Model deployment

DeveloperMessage.description: A message authored by a developer to guide the model during evaluation.

content.description: Content provided by a developer to guide model behavior in an evaluation context.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name of embedding model. It can point to a model deployment either in the parent AIServices or a connection.

displayName.description: Display Name for evaluation. It helps to find the evaluation easily in AI Foundry. It does not need to be unique.

description.description: Description of the evaluation. It can be used to store additional information about the evaluation and is mutable.

status.description: Status of the evaluation. It is set by service and is read-only.

tags.description: Evaluation's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Evaluation's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

target.description: Specifies the type and configuration of the entity used for this evaluation.

EvaluationTarget.description: Abstract base model for defining evaluation targets.

type.description: Discriminator that defines the type of the evaluation target.

values.name: modelResponseGeneration
values.description: Evaluation target that uses a model for response generation.

contentFields.description: List of fields with text content

filepathField.description: Path of file to be used as a source of text content

titleField.description: Field containing the title of the document

urlField.description: Field containing the url of the document

vectorFields.description: List of fields with vector content

metadataFields.description: List of fields with metadata content

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

ManagedAzureAISearchIndex.description: Managed Azure AI Search Index Definition

vectorStoreId.description: Vector store id of managed index

Message.description: Abstract base model representing a single message in a conversation.

role.description: The role of the message author. Known values: 'system', 'assistant', 'developer', 'user'.

modelName.description: Publisher-specific name of the deployed model

modelVersion.description: Publisher-specific version of the deployed model

modelPublisher.description: Name of the deployed model's publisher

connectionName.description: Name of the connection the deployment comes from

NoAuthenticationCredentials.description: Credentials that do not require authentication

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PendingUploadCredentialType.description: The type of credential used to access the storage account.

values.name: sas
values.description: SAS credential type.

PendingUploadRequest.description: Represents a request for a pending upload.

pendingUploadId.description: If PendingUploadId is not provided, a random GUID will be used.

connectionName.description: Azure Storage Account connection name to use for generating temporary SAS token

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type.

PendingUploadResponse.description: Represents the response for a pending upload request

version.description: Version of asset to be created if user did not specify version when initially creating upload

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type

values.name: none
values.description: No pending upload.

values.name: BlobReference
values.description: Blob Reference is the only supported type.

id.description: Identifier of the red team run.

attackStrategies.description: List of attack strategies or nested lists of attack strategies.

simulationOnly.description: Simulation-only or Simulation + Evaluation. Default false, if true the scan outputs conversation not evaluation result.

riskCategories.description: List of risk categories to generate attack objectives for.

applicationScenario.description: Application scenario for the red team operation, to generate scenario specific attacks.

tags.description: Red team's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Red team's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

status.description: Status of the red-team. It is set by service and is read-only.

target.description: Target configuration for the red-team run.

RiskCategory.description: Risk category for the attack objective.

values.name: HateUnfairness
values.description: Represents content related to hate or unfairness.

values.name: Violence
values.description: Represents content related to violence.

values.name: Sexual
values.description: Represents content of a sexual nature.

values.name: SelfHarm
values.description: Represents content related to self-harm.

SystemMessage.description: A message authored by the system to guide model behavior.

content.description: Plain text instructions provided by the system to steer model behavior.

UserMessage.description: A message authored by the end user as input to the model.

content.description: Input content or question provided by the end user.

modelResponseGenerationTarget.description: Evaluation target for generating responses using a given model and dataset.

baseMessages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.

modelDeploymentName.description: The model deployment to be evaluated. Accepts either the deployment name alone or with the connection name as '{connectionName}/modelDeploymentName'.

modelParams.description: Optional parameters passed to the model for evaluation.
